verses.text: Then Jonah prayed unto the Lord his God out of the fish's belly,

similars.text: Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.
And the Lord spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry land.
Now the word of the Lord came unto Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,
And the Lord spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry land.
Now the Lord had prepared a great fish to swallow up Jonah. And Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

verses.text: And said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the Lord, and he heard me; out of the belly of hell cried I, and thou heardest my voice.

similars.text: In my distress I cried unto the Lord, and he heard me.
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried to my God: and he did hear my voice out of his temple, and my cry did enter into his ears.
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
I cried unto the Lord with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.
I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.

And thou didst hear me because of mine afflictions and my sincerity; and it is because of thy Son that thou hast been thus merciful unto me, therefore I will cry unto thee in all mine afflictions, for in thee is my joy; for thou hast turned thy judgments away from me, because of thy Son.
I cried unto the Lord with my voice; with my voice unto the Lord did I make my supplication.
I cried to thee, O Lord; and unto the Lord I made supplication.
For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
And when we cried unto the Lord God of our fathers, the Lord heard our voice, and looked on our affliction, and our labour, and our oppression:
I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:
And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.
Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord.
For I was afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, wherewith the Lord was wroth against you to destroy you. But the Lord hearkened unto me at that time also.
But the Lord was wroth with me for your sakes, and would not hear me: and the Lord said unto me, Let it suffice thee; speak no more unto me of this matter.
Blessed be the Lord, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.
For since I spake, I cried out, I cried violence and spoil; because the word of the Lord was made a reproach unto me, and a derision, daily.
I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.
And when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.
I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.
I cried unto thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
And it came to pass that the voice of the Lord came unto my father; and he was truly chastened because of his murmuring against the Lord, insomuch that he was brought down into the depths of sorrow.
O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
And the Lord said: What hast thou done? The voice of thy brother's blood cries unto me from the ground.

And he heard a voice from heaven, saying: Enoch, my son, prophesy unto this people, and say unto them--Repent, for thus saith the Lord: I am angry with this people, and my fierce anger is kindled against them; for their hearts have waxed hard, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes cannot see afar off;
Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the Lord hath heard the voice of my weeping.
I cried unto God with my voice, even unto God with my voice; and he gave ear unto me.
I cried unto the Lord with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.
In my distress I cried unto the Lord, and he heard me.
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried to my God: and he did hear my voice out of his temple, and my cry did enter into his ears.
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
I cried unto the Lord with my voice; with my voice unto the Lord did I make my supplication.
Yea, O God, and thou wast merciful unto me when I did cry unto thee in my field; when I did cry unto thee in my prayer, and thou didst hear me.
I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
O Lord my God, I cried unto thee, and thou hast healed me.
I said unto the Lord, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.
I cried to thee, O Lord; and unto the Lord I made supplication.
For I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
I cried unto thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

And thou didst hear me because of mine afflictions and my sincerity; and it is because of thy Son that thou hast been thus merciful unto me, therefore I will cry unto thee in all mine afflictions, for in thee is my joy; for thou hast turned thy judgments away from me, because of thy Son.
Yea, O God, thou hast been merciful unto me, and heard my cries in the midst of thy congregations.
Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord.
I love the Lord, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.
And it came to pass that he cried mightily unto the Lord all that day; and behold, the voice of the Lord came unto him, saying:
Blessed be the Lord, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.
Lord, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.
And when we cried unto the Lord God of our fathers, the Lord heard our voice, and looked on our affliction, and our labour, and our oppression:
And it came to pass that the voice of the Lord came unto my father; and he was truly chastened because of his murmuring against the Lord, insomuch that he was brought down into the depths of sorrow.

verses.text: For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.

similars.text: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.

For behold, ye shall be as a whale in the midst of the sea; for the mountain waves shall dash upon you. Nevertheless, I will bring you up again out of the depths of the sea; for the winds have gone forth out of my mouth, and also the rains and the floods have I sent forth.
The waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.
Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them: they sank as lead in the mighty waters.

And behold, I prepare you against these things; for ye cannot cross this great deep save I prepare you against the waves of the sea, and the winds which have gone forth, and the floods which shall come. Therefore what will ye that I should prepare for you that ye may have light when ye are swallowed up in the depths of the sea?
For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.
O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments! then had thy peace been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea:
O that thou hadst hearkened to my commandments--then had thy peace been as a river, and thy righteousness as the waves of the sea.
I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.
The waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.

For behold, ye shall be as a whale in the midst of the sea; for the mountain waves shall dash upon you. Nevertheless, I will bring you up again out of the depths of the sea; for the winds have gone forth out of my mouth, and also the rains and the floods have I sent forth.
Thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses, through the heap of great waters.

verses.text: Then I said, I am cast out of thy sight; yet I will look again toward thy holy temple.
The waters compassed me about, even to the soul: the depth closed me round about, the weeds were wrapped about my head.

similars.text: For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.
For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas; and the floods compassed me about: all thy billows and thy waves passed over me.
The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.

verses.text: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; the earth with her bars was about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from corruption, O Lord my God.
When my soul fainted within me I remembered the Lord: and my prayer came in unto thee, into thine holy temple.

similars.text: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried to my God: and he did hear my voice out of his temple, and my cry did enter into his ears.
And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
Bless the Lord, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his holy name.
O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried to my God: and he did hear my voice out of his temple, and my cry did enter into his ears.
I cried unto thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.
My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.

verses.text: They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.
But I will sacrifice unto thee with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that that I have vowed. Salvation is of the Lord.

similars.text: I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the Lord.
Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:
I will freely sacrifice unto thee: I will praise thy name, O Lord; for it is good.
And when ye will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the Lord, offer it at your own will.
Therefore I will give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the heathen, and I will sing praises unto thy name.
I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all his people,
I will pay my vows unto the Lord now in the presence of all his people.
Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.

Yea, I know that God will give liberally to him that asketh. Yea, my God will give me, if I ask not amiss; therefore I will lift up my voice unto thee; yea, I will cry unto thee, my God, the rock of my righteousness. Behold, my voice shall forever ascend up unto thee, my rock and mine everlasting God. Amen.
Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O Lord, among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.
I will sing unto the Lord, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.
And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the Lord, ye shall offer it at your own will.
Deal bountifully with thy servant, that I may live, and keep thy word.
I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,
Inasmuch as they shall humble themselves before me, and abide in my word, and hearken to the voice of my Spirit.
Behold, this is the promise of the Lord unto you, O ye my servants.

Verily, thus saith the Lord: It shall come to pass that every soul who forsaketh his sins and cometh unto me, and calleth on my name, and obeyeth my voice, and keepeth my commandments, shall see my face and know that I am;
Behold, I, the Lord, utter my voice, and it shall be obeyed.
I will sing unto the Lord as long as I live: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
For I will fulfil my promises which I have made unto the children of men, that I will do unto them while they are in the flesh--
Lord, I have hoped for thy salvation, and done thy commandments.
I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, and will call upon the name of the Lord.
I will freely sacrifice unto thee: I will praise thy name, O Lord; for it is good.
Offer unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:
I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,
